About Me Welcome to my humble little space in the absolute vastness that is the internet.
I grew up in the early ’90s, my first console being the awesome JVC X’Eye - a Sega Genesis created through a partnership between JVC and Sega - and the first game that I can remember on that console was my beloved Dune: Battle for Arrakis.
Ever since then, I’ve been gaming. Video games became my main passion and, through it, brought me to my other hobbies like writing, world creation, drawing, and other artistic avocations many people would label as a waste of time.
In this little recessed corner that I can call my own, my aim is to write about video games, and potentially other topics like film and tabletop games, in a care-free manner. No deadlines, no politics, no people pleasing - simply very unprofessional no-bullshit reviews, general thoughts, and anecdotes from the mind of an everyday insignificant gamer.
What I Do Attempt to write about video games and my experiences with them Create mods for games like Vintage Story and Avorion Dabble, tinker and Distrohop more than a person should My Setup OS: Linux, EndeavourOS (Arch-based) Current Projects: Writing for the blog Creating a TTRPG using the Basic Role Playing system (i.e. Call of Cthulu) Attempting to actually complete a video game Computer Hardware: CPU: AMD Ryzen 9 5900X GPU: PowerColor Red Devil AMD Radeon RX 6900 XT Motherboard: Gigabyte x570 AORUS Elite RAM: G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series 2x32GB Website History The Insignificant Gamer is an independent publication launched in October 2024 by Sean R., also known by his online alias Just_Irish. This website started at Ghost and later migrated to Magic Pages (a Ghost fork) to here, the open-source static website generator Hugo
Contact Feel free to check out my work on GitHub or subscribe via RSS!
summary: Welcome to my humble little space in the absolute vastness that is the internet.

Fellow Writers & Gaming Blogs Here are some excellent gaming blogs and writers I follow:
Friends of Mine The Leanto - Brandon and Richard are quite thought provoking and I regularly look forward to reading what they have to share. Untruned Hovel - Another (or the new) project of Brandon. Important to the Gaming Sphere Gaming on Linux - A news source by Liam Dawe who focuses on Linux gaming and all news associated with it. Tabletop News and Blogs Grognardia - A fellow blogger who focuses on tabletop. Roleplaying Tips - A tabletop blogger focusing on giving you tips to make you a better Dungeon Master. The Alexandrian - Full of a lot of useful information, news and updates by Justin Alexander, an Ennie Award-winning game designer and writer. Tabletop Resources DunGen - Need to generate a quick dungeon for your tabletop session? DunGen has you covered. Dungeon Scrawl - Want to create your own quick dungeon? D-Scrawl is where it’s at. [PapersPencils - Want a dungeon made from rolling a d100? This works great, but there is nothing visual, it’s all imagination. Kassoon - Need some random items generated whether they are magical or junk? Kassoon has some generators for many things for you to take advantage of. Know a great gaming blog? Let me know!
summary: Here are some excellent gaming blogs and writers I follow:

My Mods & Projects Here are a few of the mods and projects I’ve created or contributed to. Really these are just designs rather than actual coding to form a coherent modification to a game.
Vintage Story Mods Automated Server Messages
I had a need to have messages trigger to inform players if a server restart was imminent. None of the code is mine as Claude and ChatGPT created it all, I merely had the idea.
View on GitHub
Barotrauma The Mantle My latest submarine design using all that I have learned from my previous subs. View on Steam Workshop
The Hermadin A vessel I started, forgot about, revisited and finished as quick as possible just for the sake of having it be completed. It’s still advanced compared to my other subs, just might have a lot of mistakes. View on Steam Workshop
Carpo Mk-3B Variant B of my updated and improved Carpo-series design. View on Steam Workshop
Carpo Mk-3A Variant A of my updated and improved Carpo-series design. View on Steam Workshop
Avorion My best designs thus far
Tempest-Class Cruiser A massive vessel that surprisingly had less than 3,000 blocks, is sleek, and spacious enough for many future upgrades. View on Steam Workshop
Crusader-Class Destroyer A quad-nacelle ship with plenty of potential firepower. View on Steam Workshop
Arbalest-Class Frigate An early-game vessel you can build fairly cheaply and it’ll last until at least the mid-game. View on Steam Workshop
Vigilant-Class Corvette Updated version of my starter vessel. View on Steam Workshop
Other Projects More projects coming soon!
All mods are open source. Feel free to contribute or report issues on GitHub.
